page.title: 16WOOLHOPE RECREATION
page.content:
The village hall was built in 1924 & is used by many organisations including the Women's Institute, the Young Farmers' Club & the Derby & Joan Club. It is also used for entertainments such as whist drives & bingo & for flower & other shows.
The parish owns its own playing fields called Berryfield. The name is said to have originated from the burial of victims of the plague here. The field is used for cricket, football, tennis & clay pigeon shooting as well as sports, shows & fetes. The two tennis courts were constructed in 1973 & the new pavilion was built in 1976. In both cases the money was raised locally.
